title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots begin the 2025 season under new coach Mike Vrabel, after an offseason of roster and scheme changes.
Rookie Will Campbell faces high expectations as the Patriots' new starting left tackle, following his top-5 draft selection.
The Patriots aim for improvement with new acquisitions, including receiver Stefon Diggs and defender Milton Williams.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge on trending Greater Boston news stories.
Peter Chianca, general assignment editor since 2019, contributed to the quiz's creation.
AI technology was utilized to help formulate the questions in the quiz.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox reliever Jordan Hicks placed on 15-day injured list with a shoulder injury before game against Diamondbacks.
Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA, recently allowing four runs in a loss to the Cleveland Guardians.
Hicks, acquired from Giants, faces uncertain future with Red Sox, under contract for $12 million per year until 2027.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Derrick White discusses the changes Celtics face after losing Jayson Tatum and trading key starters for financial reasons.
Boston Celtics traded Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis to manage luxury-tax issues, affecting team dynamics.
White expresses uncertainty about his role but remains motivated, seeing the underdog status as an opportunity for growth.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police determined the report of a masked man approaching a child was unfounded after a thorough investigation.
The investigation involved interviews with the child and witnesses, as well as surveillance footage review, police stated.
The incident was reported by an 11-year-old boy on Waldo Road as he walked home on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica is charged with assault using a dangerous weapon and a civil rights violation.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and struck a protester with a car door at a Cambridge demonstration.
The incident occurred during an Aug. 10 protest organized by Palestinian Youth Movement and Boston Coalition for Palestine.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Will Campbell, rookie left tackle, listed as limited due to an ankle injury ahead of Raiders game.
Starting cornerback Christian Gonzalez hasn't practiced since July due to a hamstring injury, missing the season opener.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore, recovering from 2024 blood clots, participated on a limited basis, injury not specified.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed is decomposing on Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester, causing a strong odor of rotten eggs.
The seaweed, heterosiphonia japonica, was washed ashore by strong winds from Hurricane Erin last week.
This species has spread along the East Coast since 2008, initially found off Rhode Island's coast.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM exploded at Eastern Bank in Woburn, believed to be caused by a pipe bomb or similar device.
The explosion occurred Thursday morning around 9 a.m., leading to an FBI and State Police Bomb Squad investigation.
The suspect, who remains at large, placed an object on the ATM before it detonated; no injuries were reported.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street and pronounced dead at a hospital.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violation with two prior violent/drug crimes, awaiting arraignment in Roxbury Court.
